Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
This is the Controller Class for the Corona Tracker Program
Author:
Vincent Ilagan, Ralph Sanson SECTION: S15A

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller​(java.util.ArrayList<Citizen> accounts, GUI gui)
      Initializes the newly created Controller object. The Controller retrieves the same reference of the ArrayList of accounts from the Government Official. The Constructor will read the files from the system in order to retrieve previously-saved accounts into the program. The Constructor is also necessary to implement the Action Listener to the ArrayList of JButtons found at the GUI Class.

  • Method Details

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Listens to the button presses made by the user from the GUI interface. The buttons defined in the GUI has been given unique names as identifiers in order for the Controller to distinguish between each buttons with the same Text.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

    • getAccount

      public Citizen getAccount​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Retrieves the Citizen object that belongs to the user with the same username and password.
      Parameters:
      username - - the username of the account that will check ownership.
      password - - the password of the account that will verify ownership.
      Returns:
      the Citizen object that allows the user to use its Class Methods.

    • getAccount

      public Citizen getAccount​(java.lang.String username)
      Retrieves the Citizen object that belongs to the user with the same username.
      Parameters:
      username - - the username of the account that will check ownership.
      Returns:
      the Citizen object that allows the user to use its Class Methods.

    • isUserAvailable

      public boolean isUserAvailable​(java.lang.String username)
      Verifies if the specified username is vacant or not.
      Parameters:
      username - - the username that is checked to be vacant.
      Returns:
      returns true if the username is free, false if a Citizen owns it.

    • updateTracerList

      public void updateTracerList​(java.util.ArrayList<Citizen> accounts)
      Updates a text area to contain a list of Contact Tracers.
      Parameters:
      accounts - - the ArrayList of Citizens that might contain Contact Tracers.

    • updateUnassignedCases

      public void updateUnassignedCases​(java.util.ArrayList<CoronaCase> cases)
      Updates a text area to contain a list of Unassigned Cases.
      Parameters:
      cases - - the ArrayList of cases that might be unassigned to a Contact Tracer.

    • readUserDetails

      public void readUserDetails​(Citizen currentUser)
      Updates the information of the currently logged in user.
      Parameters:
      currentUser - - the Citizen object that has logged in to the program.

    • showAssignedCases

      public void showAssignedCases​(ContactTracer user)
      Updates a text area to contain a list of Assigned Cases assigned to a particular Contact Tracer.
      Parameters:
      user - - the Contact Tracer that possesses the list of CoronaCases.

    • showCTupdates

      public void showCTupdates()
      Displays the list of cases that has not been through Contact Tracing into a text area.

    • getCases

      public java.lang.String getCases​(java.util.ArrayList<CoronaCase> CoronaCases)
      Returns a String with the list of all CoronaCases in the parameter.
      Parameters:
      CoronaCases - - the ArrayList of cases from the GovernmentOfficial.
      Returns:
      String with the list of all CoronaCases.

    • registerAccount

      public void registerAccount()
      Retrieves all information from the panel in the Registration form and creates a new account.

    • updateUserDetails

      public void updateUserDetails​(Citizen currentUser)
      Updates the Profile Information of the currently logged-in user whenever the user logs out or makes changes to the profile.
      Parameters:
      currentUser - - the currently logged-in user of the program.

    • attempt_registerAccount

      public boolean attempt_registerAccount()
      Rejects the submission form of Registration if any of the text fields are empty.
      Returns:
      returns true if the text fields are not empty, false if otherwise.

    • isDoneUpdating

      public boolean isDoneUpdating()
      Rejects the user from switching interfaces or logging out of the program if the user has not saved the changes in his/her Profile Information.
      Returns:
      returns true if all text fields are non-editable, false if otherwise.

    • isValidPassword

      public boolean isValidPassword​(char[] pass)
      Determines if the password from a JPasswordField is a valid. A valid password is a password that is 6 characters long with at least one special character.
      Parameters:
      pass - - the char[] retrieved from JPasswordField.getPassword() method.
      Returns:
      returns true if the password is valid, false if otherwise.

    • isValidPassword

      public boolean isValidPassword​(java.lang.String pass)
      Determines if the password from a JTextField is a valid. A valid password is a password that is 6 characters long with at least one special character.
      Parameters:
      pass - - the String from a text field.
      Returns:
      returns true if the password is valid, false if otherwise.

    • generatePassword

      public java.lang.String generatePassword()
      Generates a random password anywhere from 6 to 13 characters.
      Returns:
      the password randomly generated. It is for the creation of a Government Official or Contact Tracers.

    • checkDate

      public boolean checkDate​(int month, int day, int year)
      Checks the date if the date is a valid combination.
      Parameters:
      month - - the month of the year
      day - - the day of a month
      year - - the year
      Returns:
      returns true if the date combination is correct, false if otherwise.

    • parseInt

      public int parseInt​(java.lang.String num)
      Attempts to parse a String input to its int value. It will return 0 if the user makes an invalid non-number input as String.
      Parameters:
      num - - the input String that will be attempted to be converted into an int.
      Returns:
      the specified int value of the String is returned. The int value 0 is returned if the String is not a valid input.

    • parseInt_year

      public int parseInt_year​(java.lang.String year)
      Attempts to parse a String input to its int value. It will return 1970 if the user makes an invalid non-number input as String.
      Parameters:
      num - - the input String that will be attempted to be converted into an int.
      Returns:
      the specified int value of the String is returned. The int value 1970 is returned if the String is not a valid input.

    • readFile

      public static void readFile​(java.util.ArrayList<Citizen> accounts)
      Reads Master.txt, PositiveCases.txt, VisitRecords.txt, and the *.act files that belong to a particular user.
      Parameters:
      accounts - - the ArrayList of accounts for the information from the files to be copied into.

    • writeFile

      public static void writeFile()
      Writes Master.txt, PositiveCases.txt, VisitRecords.txt, and the *.act files that belong to a particular user.
